summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 between attorneys at Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP and a federal official regarding a preservation request for video surveillance footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The chain includes a follow-up expressing surprise that video was not retained, referencing an earlier request made in July 2019 for footage from the time of the incident involving their client, Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Attorney at Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP who is corresponding about a preservation request for video footage related to the Epstein incident at MCC on behalf of her client, Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney at Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP who is copied on the email correspondence regarding the video preservation request.

persons.name: Tony Ricco
persons.context: Federal official (likely with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) who is a recipient of the original July 2019 preservation request email.

persons.name: Stephanie Scannell
persons.context: Recipient of the original July 2019 preservation request email, likely a legal or administrative professional.

persons.name: Bruce Koffsky
persons.context: Recipient of the original July 2019 preservation request email, likely a legal or administrative professional.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of attorney Aida Leisenring, an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose cell was near Jeffrey Epstein's at the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incident being investigated is his death while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

connections.description: Leisenring is representing Tartaglione, as evidenced by her visiting him at MCC and making legal requests on his behalf.
Both are attorneys at the same law firm, Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP, and are collaborating on the preservation request.
Leisenring is making a formal legal preservation request to Ricco, a federal official.

events.title: Epstein Incident at MCC
events.description: The death of Jeffrey Epstein while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), which is under investigation.

events.title: Attorney Visit with Tartaglione
events.description: Aida Leisenring visited her client Nicholas Tartaglione at MCC and was given extra time for him to review discovery.

events.title: Initial Video Preservation Request
events.description: Attorney Aida Leisenring sent an email formally requesting the preservation of all video surveillance footage from the hallway outside Tartaglione's cell around the time of the Epstein incident.

events.title: Follow-up on Unretained Video
events.description: Aida Leisenring follows up, expressing surprise that the requested video footage was not retained despite previous confirmation of the preservation request.

locations: Garden City, NY 11530 (Location of Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP)
keyFacts: An attorney formally requested preservation of MCC video surveillance footage from July 22-23, 2019, related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The request was made on behalf of Nicholas Tartaglione, an inmate whose cell was near Epstein's, suggesting potential relevance to the investigation.
By December 2019, the attorney was following up because the video had not been retained, despite earlier confirmation of the preservation request.
The email chain indicates MCC staff do not have body cameras, limiting the available visual evidence.
The correspondence highlights legal efforts to secure evidence in the immediate aftermath of Epstein's death.
